Map common interface

Any map implementation in CDS library supports the following interface:

Stable interface

insert

    bool insert (const KEY &key, const VALUE &val)

Insert new item (key, val) into the map

Parameters:
keya key
vala value
Returns:
true if insertion succeeded, false otherwise (i.e. the key already in the map)

ensure

    template <typename FUNC>
    std::pair< bool, bool > ensure (const KEY &key, const VALUE &val, FUNC func)

Ensures that key key exists in map, changes data of existing item to val.

Parameters:
keya key
vala value
functhe function making change if the key exists in the map

The operation performs insert or change data with lock-free manner.

If key exists in the map then changes the value of the item pointed by key to val. The change is performed by calling user-defined function func with signature: 

        void func( VALUE& itemValue, const VALUE& val ) ;

The first argument itemValue of user-defined function func is the reference to the map's item pointed by key key. The second argument val is the value passed to ensure member function. User-defined function func must guarantee that during changing key's value no any other changes or reads could be made on this map item by concurrent threads. The user-defined function is called only if the key exists in the map.

If key is not in the map then add it.

Returns:
std::pair<bool, bool> where first is true if operation is successfull, second is true if new item has been added or false if the item with key already in the map.

emplace

    template <typename T, typename FUNC>
    bool emplace( const KEY& key, const T& val, FUNC func )

Emplaces the vale of key key with new value val

Parameters:
keya key to find
valnew value
funcfunction to change the value of key key

The operation changes the value (or a part of the value) of key key to new one val. The user-defined functor func has the purpose like func argument of ensure member function. The signature of func is 

        void func( VALUE& itemValue, const T& val ) ;

The first argument itemValue of user-defined function func is the reference to the map's item pointed by key key. The second argument val is the value passed to emplace member function. User-defined function func must guarantee that during changing key's value no any other changes could be made on this map's item by concurrent thread. The map only garantees that the item found by key cannot be deleted while func worked

Returns:
The function returns true if the key key exists in the map, false otherwise

erase

    bool erase (const KEY &key)

Erase a key key from the map

Parameters:
keya key for deleting
Returns:
true if key key found and deleted from the map, false if the key is not found in the map
Note:
The erase method is applicable for non-persistent implementation only

find

    bool find (const KEY &key)

Find a key key in the map

Parameters:
keya key finding for
Returns:
true if key found, false otherwise

find

    template <typename T, typename FUNC>
    bool find (const KEY &key, T &data, FUNC func)

Find key in the map. If key is found returns its data in data parameter.

Parameters:
keya key
vala value found
functhe user-defined function to copy item's value
Returns:
true if key found, false otherwise

If key found the function calls user-defined function func with parameters: 

        void func( T& data, const VALUE& itemValue )

where itemValue is the item found by key. The user-defined function copies the item's value itemValue or its part to data. The map guarantees only that the item found cannot be deleted while func works. The user-defined function func should take into account that concurrent threads may change the item value.

empty

    bool empty () const

Check if the map is empty.

Returns:
true if the map is empty, false otherwise

clear

    void clear ()

Clears the map. For many map implementation this function is not thread safe.

size

    size_t size() const

Returns item count. Note that size()==0 is not equal to empty()==true because of lock-free nature of the algorithms implemented in CDS library. The value returned is approximate estimation of map's item count. To check whether the map is empty you should use empty() method.
